alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Marion; Muscogee; Stewart; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 1:40PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Marion, Muscogee, Chattahoochee, Stewart and Webster Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 139 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Hawkinsville to near Sanford to White House, and moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lumpkin, Buena Vista, Cusseta, Preston, Richland, Fort Benning/lawson Army Air Fld, North Fort Benning, Weston, Bibb City, Upatoi, Putnam, Brantley, Seminole, Green Island Hills, Columbus Metropolitan Airport, Oakland, Troutman, Sanford, Benning Hills and Benning Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
